name: Edward GROCHOWSKI, Individually and on Behalf of All Other Persons Similarly Situated, Appellant, v. KEYSTONE INSURANCE COMPANY

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
parties: Edward GROCHOWSKI, Individually and on Behalf of All Other Persons Similarly Situated, Appellant, v. KEYSTONE INSURANCE COMPANY.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Arnold Levin, Gordon Gelfond, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Walter R. Milbourne, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
424 A.2d 497
Edward GROCHOWSKI, Individually and on Behalf of All Other Persons Similarly Situated, Appellant, v. KEYSTONE INSURANCE COMPANY.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 22, 1980.
Decided Jan. 27, 1981.
Arnold Levin, Gordon Gelfond, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Walter R. Milbourne, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
